item.title: Death Penalty
item.description: Capital punishment, also known as the death penalty, is a highly contentious issue that raises several moral, ethical, and practical concerns. At its core, it involves the state taking the life of a person as punishment for a crime they have been convicted of. The act of carrying out a death sentence is referred to as an “execution,” and a prisoner who is awaiting execution is often referred to as being “on death row.
